result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter from Attorney Jochman to the Court, informing the Court of the defendant's current health status.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 11/3/2022 - Given this information, the defendant's appearance at the next court hearing is excused. The Court will also address further scheduling at the next hearing.**

8:41 AM Defendant Justin T Roeschen in court.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Justin T Roeschen. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Discovery has been prepared. Defense will pick up from DA.
Hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

11:00 AM Defendant Justin T Roeschen in court with attorney Tyler A Jochman.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender  - Order Appointing Counsel filed by Tyler Jochman

08:17 AM Defendant Justin T Roeschen in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jensen previously filed a motion to withdraw as counsel.  Attorney Jensen is asking to withdraw as counsel per the defendant's request.  No objection by the State.  The Court will grant the request of Attorney Jensen and a new attorney will be appointed.  Attorney Jensen will remain attorney of record until a new attorney has been appointed from the Public Defender's Office.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Time limits were previously waived.  Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
